content: 3 half_double_crochet * you will now have 6 stitches in the space that is the first shell of stitches above the puff miss the 2 chain from the row below and crochet the following into the next space above the puff - * 3 half_double_crochet chain 1 3 half_double_crochet * repeat this another 3 times around the work you will finish with five sets of shells above each puff slip_stitch into the top of the first half_double_crochet at the beginning of this row summary chain 1 in the gaps above the puffs *3 half_double_crochet chain 1 3 half_double_crochet* five times and slip_stitch to close the round row 3 if you have a look at your star now you can see you have 5 shells making up these shells are 10 sets of 3 half_double_crochet clusters we will be alternatively working a star tip in between 5 of them and a slip_stitch in between the other 5 so star tip slip_stitch star tip slip_stitch etc we don t work in any of the half_double_crochet s themselves just between them your hook is currently in the slip_stitch space so we do not need to chain 1 to start the row in the next chain space between the half_double_crochet clusters crochet * 3 half_double_crochet 1 double_crochet chain 2 1 double_crochet 3 half_double_crochet * slip_stitch in between the next half_double_crochet cluster repeat the star tip and slip_stitch around four more times the last slip stitch goes into the same space as you began this row hang this step is optional - you can use ribbon or tie a thread to the star after to add a chain loop to hang the ornament from slip_stitch up the back stitches of the first star tip to the top don t slip_stitch into the front or back loops of the stitch use the little loops behind them when you reach the double_crochet chain a 30 chain loop slip_stitch into the back of the double_crochet on the other side of the star tip to secure you can either finish here or slip_stitch down the other side of the star tip to make it look even bind bind off and secure the end thread and the magic_ring thread hide the ends of the yarn in the work shape give the star tips a good tug outwards so that they are pointed criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/3-row-christmas-star-ornament criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/3-row-christmas-star-ornament
